content.question: In which of the following ways did slavery change in the late 1700s?

choices.label: The expansion of slavery into the Northwest Territory became a divisive political issue in the new United States.
The ideals of the American Revolution prompted some individuals and groups to call for the abolition of slavery.
The argument that slavery was a positive social institution became widely accepted.
The holding of slaves as property became a symbol of social status in the North.

content.answer: The ideals of the American Revolution prompted some individuals and groups to call for the abolition of slavery.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
